At this point, I refused to believe the pictures on the menu or the wall because the Korean BBQ taco was 4 times smaller than what picture had. We ended up getting BBQ Chicken Pizza w/ Bacon. The pizza is somewhat of middle size pizza you'd get from Papa Johns. It was perfect for my friend (girl) and I to share because I don't eat a lot of foods and she's a girl. We finished our meal with fullness. However, I do believe if two dudes go to this restaurant, they'd need to order one for each. The taste? I thought it was alright, nothing spectacular. I think local pizzeria can match it or even top this place. I definitely had better pizza elsewhere - most notably from New York. The waiter was probably in hurry. He gave us check way before we finished our foods. I thought this was very rude because we were trying to enjoy our meal but the check just ruins it. Again, just no enthusiasm from him what so ever. It would've been better if we had better server because he was not happy working there. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're really craving some cheap pizza for yourself. They do have lots of different choices for pizza and I'm sure they're all pretty tasty. For me, I'd only come back to this place because I live close by and lazy to go in to city for better pizza (ie. Matchbox). Definitely more of family dining place than take-your-date restaurant.

Now not alot of people know this but they have the best Tiramisu. I'm not sure where they get it and I really dont care but whenever I crave Tiramisu, I can count on CPK.  Sit by the counter for faster service, get a half salad, order a glass of wine for $5 and top it off with a tiramisu. Perfection.

I hated not liking it. I've been a fan when I was in San Jose, tried it here with excitement, a complementary avocado/ corn salad and tortilla chips was great, caesar salad was good, I headed for the BBQ chicken pizza, the dough was too sweet that it made me sad. Imagine barbecue sauce as a salty catalyst to the sugary dough =/
Interesting Mac and Cheese appetizer. Service slow, pizza ok.

BBQ chicken salad is so good. I always get this every time I've come over here for  the past 10 years! LOL. I just cant get sick of it. Yummmmmmm I did branch out and ordered the spicy chicken quesadilla appetizer. It was pretty good as well. Not to spicy or bland...just right.

The service here is an absolute joke. Single white females traveling alone on business are apparently invisible.  I showed up last Thursday afternoon, a little after 6:30. I was staying at the hotel across the street from this location, and was interested in getting an early dinner and a cocktail, without dealing with the scene in the hotel lounge or paying the ridiculous mark-up for room service. I was still wearing my suit, though I had switched out my heels for walking shoes. Not that this is the Ritz, but I was looking neat and orderly.  No one was waiting when I entered, and there were several empty tables on the floor, at least five spots at the bar, and only two couples on the patio. Regardless, I made a point of asking the hostess if they were too busy for a single diner. She just sighed, disgusted, and asked where I wanted to sit. I agreeably said anywhere was fine. She plopped my menu on a table close to the door and marched off, never to be seen again.  I waited for 30+ minutes. No one ever even offered me a glass of water. I tried to make eye contact with every server that went by, but they studiously looked down. Three staffers (one turned out to be the MANAGER!) were laughing and carrying on by the kitchen door.  When I finally demanded to speak to the manager, she was more upset by my angry tone than with the abject FAILURE of her staff to provide service to a customer. She said that the servers were "on break" and if I wanted to be served, I could ask for take-away. I pointed out that I had been waiting half an hour, and that if paying customers were waiting, then no one should be "on break." I added that in that time, several men (at the bar) and a family of four (on the floor) had all been seated and were now eating.  "What do you want me to do?" she sneered. At this, I finally lost my cool and told her EXACTLY what I wanted her to do, then marched out.  Congratulations, CPK. I will never patronize you again.

I'm an Italian chopped salad addict (without the meat) and this location always has good, fresh, ingredients.  Very reliable for all your favorite CPK menu items, and it's got a lot of tables so you usually don't have a wait to be seated.  Very satisfied with this CPK - try to go every time I'm in town.

With a couple of young kids in tow, even hard core foodies (aka snobs) start to look for different things in frequented restaurants.  We still expect to eat well and value solid service, but things like an ample kids menus and comfy booths, where you shouldn't get dirty looks if your toddler gets out of hand, might trump valrhona chocolate desserts. My family has been frequenting CPK in Arlington, VA now for about 4 years.  Compared to other CPKs that we have visited, I would rate this one highly.  The food is consistent, the service is great and it's a very clean establishment. My kids love CPK.  They have an excellent kids menu both in that there are lots of fun activities (it's a book) in it, and they have a huge selection.  Mom likes it too since they have healthy sides like fresh fruit and vegetables. If you are new to CPK and wondering if you should go, because maybe you are not in the mood for pizza, I'll tell you that I am mainly drawn to the array of salads, which are very good.  Do not miss the Tri-Colore "Salad" which is listed with the pizzas.  This is, in my opinion, the best dish on the menu.  Simple, yet perfect blend of greens, sweet tomato bites and a nice pungent grana parmesan tossed in homemade Dijon balsamic vinaigrette. I also often order the Four-Cheese Raviolis with Mushrooms which are pretty good, but I do think it was better a couple of years ago (although that could be because I was pregnant then and was having cravings for this dish).  Another great dish and odd for a pizza restaurant, are the Fish Tacos.  The fact that the fish is sautéed is a real plus for me since I don't like fish tacos that are prepared with fried fish. We like the selection of small plates and appetizers, but sometimes I am left thinking that we didn't get a good bang for our buck.  For example, I remember ordering the Tuscan Hummus for the table but it was really only enough for maybe 2 people with a couple of spoonfuls of hummus.  They have these really tasty Korean BBQ Steak Tacos  with napa cabbage on the Small Cravings Menu--I wish they had a full sized dinner of these. The desserts are pretty good, but as a chocolate connoisseur, the Chocolate Soufflé Cake was disappointing in that is just doesn't taste like a high quality chocolate.  A decent chocolate layer cake would probably suit CPK better.  We like the Butter Cake which is like a pound cake and the Red Velvet Cake, but skip the Tiramisu, it is unmemorable. As for beverages, for the level of dining that CPK is -- a family restaurant -- the liquor, wine and beer selection is pretty good, but if you are looking for a pre-func Negroni, you may have to teach the bartender how to make it.

I've had very inconsistent experiences with the service here, but overall I love the food and drinks so I keep coming back.  FAVES: - asparagus & arugula salad - mediterranean plate (but ask for extra pita because they give you a very small portion) - white corn guac & chips - baja fish tacos - lettuce wraps - peach iced tea

This place never fails to offer fresh food, the pizza is to our taste and the fresh salads and appetizers always go down well. The service is good but not too cloying like some places that constantly ask you *Are you ok?* Trust me if I am not ok you are going to hear about it! They are very accommodating with taking the pizza out if you cant finish it, which we often do as then we get to have an appetizer and the butter cake... the only thing better than the pizza at this place is the butter cake. So when you go first try the pizza and then try the butter cake, if you don't have any kind of sweet tooth then try the wraps appetizer.

I usually have a pretty satisfying experience at any CPK that I've tried (Honolulu, Omaha, NYC, Arlington).  I met up with a friend from home at this location.  It was around 8 pm on a weekday and the restaurant wasn't very busy.  The food was delicious as usual (I got a BBQ chicken pizza - always a safe bet), but the service was just okay.  We received our food within 15 minutes of placing our order but the waitress seemed like she was ready to clock out.  Overall the experience was okay.

The first time I tried CPK was out in LA and I looooved it! So I was very excited when I moved here and there was one right outside my metro. The food is pretty good and generally what youre expected to get. Decent pizza combinations and big, filling salads. I also happen to LOVE LOVE their flavored iced teas...I've tried mango and peach and theyre both delicious! The two stars are being subtracted 1) for service and 2) for the weird smell. The service is spotty - I've had waiters who were overly annoying and ones that I barely saw..and ones that were just straight up a little strange.  Also for some reason, the last two times I was in there, the placed had this lovely subtle foot smell. Not too sure why, food came out fine but I couldn't get over the fact that it smelled slightly foul in there.

California Pizza Kitchen, how I drool for thee. Your chinese food makes me happy, and your pizzas are excellently done. This fairly large CPK in the Mall extension next to Pentagon City Mall, does a booming business. If you're in the mall, and it's raining, you can take the Metro tunnel under the street and pop up next to the extension mall entrance and the CPK. The interior is somewhat 'so-so" compared to other CPKs, but if you get there - try their BBQ Chicken Pizza. It's excellent, although if you are a big garlic fan - the garlic chicken pizza or the White Pizza are also good choices. Be forewarned: They do validate parking, but not much - and their lot is pricey. Better to take the Metro there if you can.

I am from California, so I LOVE CPK.  But I had to give this one just 3 stars, because the experience differs every time.  Sometimes very good, sometimes not so good.  For example - I got the California Club pizza a few days ago.  The service was great, but the pizza crust was completely overcooked.  It actually crumbled while I ate it.   On the flip side, I ordered the Tostada pizza (my favorite!!) a few months ago - and it was perfect.  I've been there several times, and that's been my experience - sometimes, just right, sometimes completely off.  The service has always been consistently very good, though.  And you can't beat the prices for gourmet pizzas.

I lived in Italy for years, and the pizza at CPK is lousy.  I can't believe how bad it was.  I went with other people and so I tried 3 different kinds of pizza.  The only good part was that the meat on the Sicilian pizza was high-quality.  I've never had "bad" pizza, kind of like I've never had "bad" ice cream, but compared to other pizzas, I don't like the CPK.  I'm only giving it 2 stars (instead of one star) because all pizza is good, even though this pizza is on the bottom end of the scale.  The location in Arlington is great and the staff was friendly.  The product was just well below average.
I love the pizzas and salads but hate eating inside because of the loud music.

Do not I repeat do not come here btw 1130 and 130 for lunch. Been here on 3 occasions just to test my theory. The first time I waited 39 mins for my food AFTER I ordered it. The second time I sent my food back cause it was cold. I waited a total of 46 minutes before I ate. The third time was a joke. Long story short, we left to eat somewhere else because the food took so long. Here's the kicker...all 3 times I ordered a ceasar salad! Really!!! Over 30 min for a salad.

Not a good meal.  Hubby had salmon and it was okay.  The pasta was hard and lukewarm.  The asparagus was cold.  I had steak tacos.  Not good.  Can't explain why.  Just wasn't good.  The chips were stale and the salsa blah and bland   Hubby's Cosmo was good.  My mango mango mojito was okay.  We will not be going back even though we got two more Thank You cards.  To make matter worse, we has to pay for one hour of parking even with a validated ticket.

The food is decent, and the pizza is predictable.  I like it but it's nothing fantastic. Lunch time is not a fun time to go, and every time i've gone to this location there has been a LONG wait.  unneccesarily long. It's also a bit pricey for what you get.

Firstly, the staff here is always nice - much appreciated!!  I would come in and they usually knew that I wanted my bread toasted and would have it ready ahead of time.   NOW, this is a pizza kitchen, and most come for the pizza.  I always have to be different.  I'm more of the Cobb/BBQ salad & peach iced tea kind of lady.  However, my absolute favorite item on the menu is the chicken chowder.  YES, I know, it's the typical Tex-Mex sort of fare; with the corn, tortilla strips and all that.  I have a confession to make - I always order two cups - dinner portion size.  I will eat it morning, noon and night if I want to.  This is one chain that I'm not ashamed to say I love.  The soup, alone, deserves four stars.  Creamy, flavorful and filling - it is.   Super-sweet customer service, and top-notch location does it every time.  So, do I qualify as a CPK groupie?  Methinks.
Love this location.  Servers were great.  New small plates menu is amazing.  Made a meal out of two of them.  It's the perfect end to a great shopping trip to Pentagon City Mall.

Note: The following must be narrated in the voice of Arnold Schwarzenegger for proper effect.  Today my appetite was really gigantic, like a handsome barbarian. All the restaurants in Pentagon City are for sissies. Except CPK. CPK is where I go to save John Connor from the T-1000. Haha. Just kidding. I eat pizza here.  The pizza I ordered is called a jerk chicken pizza. It's not too big, but neither is the California deficit. Haha. Just kidding. The deficit is really gigantic.  I ate here with a girly woman, so I was forced to order soup. If I were by myself this would never have happened. It was the asparagus soup with the croutons. It tasted like a cybernetic poly-alloy. Liquid metal.  After we demolished the food, I planned an ingenious escape through the confusing revolving door to the metro stop right outside. Then we... Get down! Get back to the chopper!

First I have to say that before Saturday night, I hadn't been to a California Pizza Kitchen in years. I was still expecting an in & out 'diner' type of feel, but they've seriously upgraded. I had to take the time out to give this particular location a Yelp because our server that night was phenomenal. She knew the menu, the specials and even told us about the new wine menu. (If I knew any better, I would dare to call her a sommelier - after explaining the wine menu, she brought samples to the table and walked us through the tasting and comparing. Seriously, where else does that happen?!) The appetizers were great, but I'd ordered a Carne Asada pizza and wasn't really satisfied with it. It wasn't terrible, but honestly, I was going to pay for it anyway - I didn't think about having it taken back since I'd eaten about 3 slices already. J*, our server, came around to check on us and she asked how I'd liked my meal. I said it was kinda so-so and do you know what she did? She took it off the tab! Color me amazed! Even with the not-so-great pizza I ordered (my fault), I really have to give this CPK 5 stars for the service.

There are many gourmet pizza places in and around Washington and I am sure they all have amazing pizza but my weakness is Margarita Pizza. Whenever I try q new Pizza restaurant I will go for Margarita. For a chain California pizza kitchen makes one extremely thin, crusty and prefect Margarita. Its my ritual  to pick one from day every Friday night. The California pizza kitchen in Arlington is one handful in their chain that still uses wood burning oven and it shows.

I haven't eaten at this CPK in a while, but it's definitely changed.  The food is still outstanding, but the menu is much smaller, there's not as many waitstaff as I've seen previously, and there's been no wait whatsoever for a table with the two times I've eaten lunch there over the past two weeks.  On previous visits with a party of two or four, I've waited 10-30 minutes for a table to clear.  Another reviewer mentioned about the long wait for your food order.  They are absolutely right, but there's also equally long waits to get waited on and to get your bill paid.

This is pseudo-gourmet pizza.  At this point in the life of California Pizza Kitchen, you are just as well off getting one of their frozen pizzas from the grocery store.  CPK is reduced to being nothing more than just ordinary.  For what you pay, you are getting a small pizza, with 8 small slices.  It is about enough for 2 people with moderate appetites.  I think the BBQ chicken pizza is fine, but not great.  The carne asada pizza is also good but not great.  I just think there are better options in the DC area than CPK.  It is a convenient location right next to the Metro, and is ideal for take out on the way home.

Overall, good food, fresh ingredients, very California. Everything could go with a little more spice, or at least some choices on the table (like red pepper flakes, hot sauce) BUT... Considering  the prices...   eg $9 for a glass of Santa Marguerita Pinot Grigio, $15 for a very modest sized Asian Salad - I think it's very pricey, especially since the atmosphere is big chain, and the service is okay... Just okay. The pizza is good, not great. Crust a little too sweet, and we didn't even have the whole wheat crust. I would go again if I was famished and shopping nearby and there was no line. Otherwise, I'd pick another place.
I love the adobe chicken chowder is my favorite item on the menu. The pizza is ok, not a great as you would expect but it's decent. They do have a full bar so that's a plus.

I haven't been herre in a while but I met up with a friend for dinner.  I usually like to get their bbq chicken salad although I was tempted to get pasta.   For some reason, they don't make the one pasta dish that I used to really like....some creamy dish with bacon and peas.  Maybe it was because it was a million calories and an instant heart attack. The waitress was very attentive in the beginning but then she kind of disappeared.  Maybe she felt like she was interupting us.  It wasnt a big deal.  We just wanted boxes to take home our stuff.  The salad was delicious as usual.

I always get the best waitresses here. But Ms. Lola is the best! The food is great and I always leave satisfied!!!! Oh and folks you have to try the Garlic Cream Fettuccine w/mushrooms and shrimp and Peach Lemonade

Okay, so I like this place. They have good offerings and something will appeal to everyone in the group. I like the garlic chicken pizza and also their bbq chicken salad. I feel like its a decent value.

This place is a great, sunny place to eat lunch while on a shopping excursion at wonderful Pentagon City (and Centre). The service is friendly and the food is great and reasonably priced (but watch out for the desserts, as they're a bit more expensive). They also have a varied kid's menu, with lots to choose from. I highly recommend eating here!

I got the salmon with asparagus and noodles. The salmon was dry, and the noodles were way too sour for my taste. The waitress was ok, the italian soda was way too water down. The hamburger pizza was really good though. The food is ok, and you got to try this yourself.

Definitely a fan!  I normally don't ever choose to go to a chain restaurant but this is one I crave for quite often.  I always have a little internal battle about whether to order a pizza (I love the shrimp scampi, thai chicken, and pear and gorgonzola (yes I know that doesn't sound like a good pizza, but it is!!!))  or if I should order soup and salad!  I am a big fan of the pea soup and the field green salad (they are giant so a half size has always been sufficient).  The service has never been astounding but it's a dependable place for a tasty lunch or dinner.
